CityOfMistTracker.trackerwindow.title: City of Mist Status Tracker
CityOfMistTracker.trackerwindow.empty: Place a token on the scene to start the tracker.
CityOfMist.terms.name: Name
Legend.moves.outcome.fail: The Narrator decides on a narrative development detrimental to the Hero, and can give or remove a tag or status in a way that hinders the Hero.
Legend.moves.outcome.partial:
The action unfolds as expected, or better, achieving its intended goal or overcoming an obstacle. The Narrator can also give you a useful tag or status. 
 The Narrator decides on a narrative development detrimental to the Hero, and can give or remove a tag or status in a way that hinders the Hero.
Legend.moves.outcome.success:
The action unfolds as expected, or better, achieving its intended goal or overcoming an obstacle. The Narrator can also give you a useful tag or status. 
 You can Push your Luck: 
 Accept Consequences for Great Success (Quick) or for +1 Power to spend (Detailed).
Legend.moves.reaction.name: Reaction
Legend.moves.quickOutcome.name: Quick Outcome
Legend.moves.detailedOutcome.name: Detailed Outcome
Legend.moves.reaction.partial: You succeed and may spend PWR Power only to lessen the Consequences.
Legend.moves.reaction.success: You succeed and may spend PWR+1 Power, on any Effect.
Legend.moves.sacrifice.fail:
It is in Vain...
You pay in full the Consequence of your Sacrifice, but nothing comes out of it, or things go terribly wrong. The Narrator may add further Consequences (especially Ill Tidings).
Legend.moves.sacrifice.partial:
It is Fate!
You Succeed but pay in full the Consequences of your Sacrifice.
Legend.moves.sacrifice.success:
It is a Miracle!
You Succeed and your Sacrifice is lessened by one level.
Legend.moves.sacrifice.painful.name: Sacrifice (Painful)
Legend.moves.sacrifice.painful.consequen: Scratch all tags in a relevant theme (only one tag if lessened)
Legend.moves.sacrifice.painful.successfu:
Achieve something unlikely or that would normally take much longer or require much more resources 
 Match the Might of a Challenge one level higher or lower than you have in this situation for the duration of a scene.
Legend.moves.sacrifice.scarring.name: Sacrifice (Scarring)
Legend.moves.sacrifice.scarring.successf:
Achieve something extraordinary. 
 Match the Might of a Challenge two levels higher or lower than you have in this situation for the duration of a scene.
Legend.moves.sacrifice.grave.name: Sacrifice (Grave)
Legend.moves.sacrifice.grave.consequence: Take a tier-6 status without lessening
Legend.moves.sacrifice.grave.successful:
Achieve something impossible. 
 Save someone from certain death or bring them back from the dead (if the moment allows for it).
Legend.themebook.duty.name: Duty
Legend.themebook.influence.name: Influence

MistEngine.rollEffects.effect.attack.hin: Give your target a harmful status
MistEngine.rollEffects.effect.disrupt.hi: Give your target a hindering tag or status
Give your target a compelling status
MistEngine.rollEffects.effect.weaken.hin: Remove a target's useful tag or status
MistEngine.rollEffects.effect.bestow.hin: Give yourself or an ally new abilities using tags
MistEngine.rollEffects.effect.create.hin: Create a new Object or Being using tags
MistEngine.rollEffects.effect.enhance.hi: Give yourself or an ally a helpful status
MistEngine.rollEffects.effect.restore.hi: reduce a harmful status or recover a burnt power tag
MistEngine.tag.category.hindering.name: Hindering
MistEngine.tag.category.weakening.name: Weakening
MistEngine.tag.category.ability.name: Ability
MistEngine.tag.category.empower.name: Empower
MistEngine.tag.category.object.name: Object
MistEngine.tag.category.being.name: Being
MistEngine.status.category.harm.name: Harm
MistEngine.status.category.shield.name: Shield
MistEngine.status.category.restore.name: Restore
MistEngine.status.category.advance.name: Advance
MistEngine.status.category.set-back.name: Set Back
MistEngine.status.category.progress.name: Progress
MistEngine.status.category.polar.name: Polar
CityOfMist.terms.loadoutTheme.name: Loadout Theme
Otherscape.terms.loadoutTheme.name: Loadout
Legend.terms.loadoutTheme.name: Backpack
CityOfMist.moves.CTG.name: Change the Game
CityOfMist.moves.CTG.partial: You get PWR Juice. Spend your Juice to gain the following effects, one-to-one:
CityOfMist.moves.CTG.success: You get PWRM2 Juice. Spend your Juice to gain the following effects, one-to-one:
CityOfMist.moves.CTG.dynamite: You get PWRM3 Juice. Spend your Juice to gain the following effects, one-to-one:
CityOfMist.moves.CTG.1: Burn a power tag or story tag
CityOfMist.moves.CTG.2: Give or reduce a status (one tier per point of juice)
CityOfMist.moves.CTG.3: Scale up the effect (greater area or more targets)
CityOfMist.moves.CTG.6: Any other improvement you and the MC agree on
CityOfMist.moves.convince.name: Convince
CityOfMist.moves.convince.partial: Choose a relevant status with tier PWR. Your target can choose either to take the status or give in a little, but protect their own agenda.
CityOfMist.moves.convince.success: Choose a relevant status of tier PWR. Your target can choose either to take the status or change their agenda to include yours, at least for the time being.
CityOfMist.moves.convince.dynamite: Choose a relevant status of tier PWR+2. Your target can choose either to take the status or change their agenda to include yours, at least for the time being. If the target gives in they also take a tier 2 temporary status  representing your influence. It can't be the same status as if they refused.
CityOfMist.moves.FD.name: Face Danger
CityOfMist.moves.FD.partial: you take the status, but with -1 tier.
CityOfMist.moves.FD.success: you fend off the effect and take no status at all.
CityOfMist.moves.FD.dynamite: Avoid the status completely and choose one:
CityOfMist.moves.FD.0: You reflect the status at your attacker or otherwise use it against them. You give your attacker an appropriate status of your choice with tier equal to the tier of the original status.
CityOfMist.moves.FD.1: You bolster your defenses. You take an appropriate ongoing tier-1 status of your choice describing your improved defenses.
CityOfMist.moves.GTTT.name: Go Toe To Toe
CityOfMist.moves.GTTT.dynamite: You get all of the following:
CityOfMist.moves.GTTT.0: You manage to achieve your goal, e.g., take something they hold.
CityOfMist.moves.GTTT.1: You get them good, giving your opponent a status with tier PWR.
CityOfMist.moves.GTTT.2: You block, dodge, or counter their best attempts. If you don’t choose this, they can impose a status on you. If they are a PC, its tier=their Power.
CityOfMist.moves.HWAYG.name: Hit with all You've Got
CityOfMist.moves.HWAYG.partial: You give the target an appropriate status of your choice with tier PWR. Choose one:
CityOfMist.moves.HWAYG.success: You give the target an appropriate status of your choice with tier PWR. Choose two:
CityOfMist.moves.HWAYG.dynamite: You give the target an appropriate status of your choice with tier PWR. Choose one option from the Dynamite List:
CityOfMist.moves.HWAYG.0: You take cover or secure a superior position. If you don’t choose this, they can impose a status on you. If they are a PC, its tier=their Power.
CityOfMist.moves.HWAYG.1: You get them good or get many of them (+1 tier)
CityOfMist.moves.HWAYG.3: You hold the target’s attention, if possible.
CityOfMist.moves.HWAYG.4: You gain the upper hand. Take 1 Juice.
CityOfMist.moves.HWAYG.5: (Dynamite) Outstanding hit: Choose three options from the move’s standard list.
CityOfMist.moves.HWAYG.6: (Dynamite) Defend another: You protect both yourself and another ally from a counterstrike. The target of your attack cannot attack that ally on the target’s next move.
CityOfMist.moves.HWAYG.7: (Dynamite) Hit them hard: You hit them hard, increasing the tier of the status you give by two or hitting two more targets with the same status.
CityOfMist.moves.HWAYG.8: (Dynamite) Extreme collateral damage: everything and everyone around the target takes a status similar to the main status, with a tier equal to Power. This includes you or any allies, if you are nearby.
CityOfMist.moves.HWAYG.9: (Dynamite) Control the conflict: Take 2 Juice and you can use it to choose effect improvements from Change the Game.
CityOfMist.moves.investigate.name: Investigate
CityOfMist.moves.investigate.partial: You get PWR clues. Spend your Clues one-to-one to ask the MC a question about the subject of your investigation or ask another player a relevant question about their character. They must give you either a straight answer or a solid lead. The MC can choose one complication:
CityOfMist.moves.investigate.success: You get PWR clues. Spend your Clues one-to-one to ask the MC a question about the subject of your investigation or ask another player a relevant question about their character. They must give you either a straight answer or a solid lead.
CityOfMist.moves.investigate.dynamite: You get PWR clues. Your investigation reveals a key detail. The MC will reveal the most valuable detail in the scene that your investigation could reveal. You can then use your Clues to ask follow-up questions or other questions as usual.
CityOfMist.moves.investigate.0: Your investigation exposes you to danger
CityOfMist.moves.investigate.1: The clues you get are fuzzy, incomplete, or part-true part-false.
CityOfMist.moves.investigate.2: Whoever or whatever you are asking the question(s) can ask you one question as well. You answer on the same terms.
CityOfMist.moves.lookBeyond.name: Look Beyond the Mist
CityOfMist.moves.sneak.name: Sneak Around
CityOfMist.moves.sneak.partial: Everyone that should fall for it falls for it. The MC chooses one complication:
CityOfMist.moves.sneak.success: Everyone that should fall for it falls for it.
CityOfMist.moves.sneak.dynamite: Your target is so entirely fooled by your secretive or deceptive actions that you can continue to move and/or act completely undetected by this target for the rest of the scene, so long as you do so in the same way you did when you scored 12 or more.
CityOfMist.moves.sneak.0: Someone unimportant noticed you, but that just made them important, right?
CityOfMist.moves.sneak.1: You are perceived only by a secondary sense (someone picks up your scent while you’re stalking them; you’re seen whispering a message but the message is not heard).
CityOfMist.moves.sneak.2: You must leave something important behind – or be discovered.
CityOfMist.moves.TTR.name: Take the Risk
CityOfMist.moves.TTR.partial: Things get messy. The MC will offer you a hard bargain or an ugly choice.
CityOfMist.moves.TTR.dynamite: You pull it off spectacularly and even turn the situation to your advantage. Take 2 Juice and you can use it to choose effect improvements from Change the Game.
CityOfMist.moves.SHB.significant.name: Stop. Holding. Back. (Significant)
CityOfMist.moves.SHB.significant.fail: SOMETHING TERRIBLE HAPPENS. Also, mark Fade/Crack and burn all the power tags on one theme.
CityOfMist.moves.SHB.significant.partial: You achieve what you were trying to do. Mark Fade/Crack and burn all the power tags on one theme.
CityOfMist.moves.SHB.significant.success: You achieve what you were trying to do. Mark Fade/Crack on one theme.
CityOfMist.moves.SHB.noReturn.name: Stop. Holding. Back. (No-Return)
CityOfMist.moves.SHB.noReturn.fail: SOMETHING TERRIBLE HAPPENS. Also, replace one theme.
CityOfMist.moves.SHB.noReturn.partial: You achieve what you were trying to do. Replace one theme.
CityOfMist.moves.SHB.noReturn.success: You achieve what you were trying to do. Mark Fade/Crack and burn all the power tags on one theme.
CityOfMist.moves.SHB.ultimate.name: Stop. Holding. Back. (Ultimate)
CityOfMist.moves.SHB.ultimate.fail: SOMETHING TERRIBLE HAPPENS. Also, Take a tier-6 status. You cannot Face Danger.
CityOfMist.moves.SHB.ultimate.partial: You achieve what you were trying to do. Take a tier-6 status. You cannot Face Danger.
CityOfMist.moves.SHB.ultimate.success: You achieve what you were trying to do. Replace one theme.
CityOfMist.moves.downtime.name: Downtime
CityOfMist.moves.downtime.always: Whenever your character has some downtime, choose one way to spend it:
CityOfMist.moves.downtime.0: Give attention to one of your Logos (or extra) themes. Tell everyone at the table how you do it and mark Attention on that theme.
CityOfMist.moves.downtime.1: Work the case. Tell everyone at the table how you do it, and gain 3 Clues with a method and a source based on your description
CityOfMist.moves.downtime.2: Explore your Mythos. Tell everyone at the table which Mystery you explore and how you do it. You gain 1 Clue with a method and a source based on your description. Mark Attention on that Mystery’s theme.
CityOfMist.moves.downtime.3: Prepare for your next activity. Tell everyone at the table how you prepare and choose one: recover all your burnt power tags OR gain 3 Juice with a method based on your description. You can choose from the effect improvements under Change the Game.
CityOfMist.moves.downtime.4: Recover from your last activity. For each ongoing status still affecting you, the MC will tell you if and how it can be reduced during your downtime and by how many tiers. Alternatively, the MC can allow you to reduce any or some of your statuses by one tier for each relevant tag you have.
CityOfMist.moves.answers.name: Finally, Some Answers
CityOfMist.moves.answers.always: When you find answers to your Mystery, choose one, two, or all three:
CityOfMist.moves.answers.0: You gain a deeper understanding of your Mythos, of the subject of your Mystery, or of the link between your Mystery and your Mythos. Mark Attention on the theme to which this Mystery belongs.
CityOfMist.moves.answers.1: You are shocked by the discovery to the point of rejecting your Mythos or an aspect of your ordinary life. Mark Fade or Crack on any theme.
CityOfMist.moves.answers.2: Your questions are answered. Choose a new Mystery for this theme.
CityOfMist.moves.flashback.name: Flashback
CityOfMist.moves.flashback.always: Once per session, when you have the spotlight, choose 1:
CityOfMist.moves.flashback.0: Describe an action carried out by your character in the past and make a move for that action. The outcome of the move affects the current scene.
CityOfMist.moves.flashback.1: Describe events from your character’s backstory that become relevant now. The MC can award you with 1 Juice or 1 Clue based on your description.
CityOfMist.moves.foreshadowing.name: Foreshadowing
CityOfMist.moves.foreshadowing.miss: You're safe for now. Your nemesis will not take part in the next session.
CityOfMist.moves.foreshadowing.partial: You can sense your nemesis is coming but you're not sure. The MC can choose whether to include your Nemesis in the next session or not. If she does, she does not get to make a surprise MC move.
CityOfMist.moves.foreshadowing.success: One of your Nemeses will overwhelm you or get the drop on you in the next session. When the MC introduces your nemesis, she also gets to make a move as if you missed a player move.
CityOfMist.moves.hardchoice.name: Make A Hard Choice
CityOfMist.moves.hardchoice.0: When answers to your Mystery are within reach, but you forego them, mark Fade on that Mystery’s theme.
CityOfMist.moves.hardchoice.1: When your Identity demands you act or speak in a given way and you don’t, mark Crack on that Identity’s theme.
CityOfMist.moves.hardchoice.2: When you sacrifice something you truly want in order to abide by your Identity, mark Attention on that Identity’s theme
CityOfMist.moves.monologue.name: Opening Monologue
CityOfMist.moves.monologue.always: At the beginning of every session, one player goes into a monologue as his or her character, relating the character’s thoughts and feelings at this point in the story.
CityOfMist.moves.sessionEnd.name: Session End
CityOfMist.moves.sessionEnd.always: At the end of the session, when the credit roll, go around the table. Each player can answer one or more of the following questions:
CityOfMist.moves.sessionEnd.0: How has the crew grown this session? Recover a burnt crew power tag or mark Attention on a crew theme.
CityOfMist.moves.sessionEnd.1: Which character had the most meaningful interaction with your character this session? Add one Help point or one Hurt point next to their name on your character card.
CityOfMist.moves.sessionEnd.2: Which of your themes is under the most strain? If it collapses, what new aspect will show up in its place? Write down the answer under FLIPSIDE on that theme’s card.
CityOfMist.moves.escapeFromMemory.name: Escape From Memory
CityOfMist.moves.performanceReview.name: Performance Review
CityOfMist.moves.performanceReview.alway:
When you receive credit from your superiors for successfully accomplishing a task given to you as a Directive, mark Attention on its theme. You may also mark Crack on one of your Logos themes to represent an upcoming promotion


When you are accused by your superiors of failing to accomplish a task given to you as a Directive or crossing a line defined by a Directive, mark 1 Strike on the Directive’s theme (2 Strikes if your transgression was especially severe, as chosen by your superiors).


When the Directive is resolved, or if your superiors elect to reassign you, choose an appropriate new Directive for this theme with the MC.
CityOfMist.moves.hardchoiceGK.name: Make a Hard Choice (Gatekeeper)
CityOfMist.moves.hardchoiceGK.always:
When following your Directive demands you act or speak in a given way and you don’t, if it’s discovered, it will show up on your Performance Review.


When your Identity demands you act or speak in a given way and you don’t, mark Crack on that Identity’s theme.


When you sacrifice something you truly want in order to abide by your Identity, mark Attention on that Identity’s theme.
CityOfMist.moves.LBTM.name: Look Behind the Mist
Otherscape.moves.quickOutcome.name: Quick Outcome
Otherscape.moves.quickOutcome.fail: Something doesn't work as intended and there are adverse consequences.
Otherscape.moves.quickOutcome.partial: The action succeeds or benefits the PC but there are still some consequences
Otherscape.moves.quickOutcome.success: The action succeeds as intended, or better. There are no consequences, the player may choose to take consequences for an even greater degree of success
Otherscape.moves.trackedOutcome.name: Tracked Outcome
Otherscape.moves.trackedOutcome.partial: Suffer a consequence and choose effects of Power PWR (Otherscape Page 90).
Otherscape.moves.trackedOutcome.success: Choose effects equal to your Power (PWR) (otherscape Page 90).
Otherscape.moves.mitigate.name: Mitigate Consequences
Otherscape.moves.mitigate.partial: Spend PWR power to mitigate the consequences.
Otherscape.moves.mitigate.success: spend PWR+1 power to mitigate the consequences or use reflexive effects.
Otherscape.moves.blazeOfGlory.significan: The moment turns agaisnt you or you fail to achieve what you hoped. Burn all tags in a theme (choose which before rolling).
You achieve what you wanted. Burn all tags in a theme (choose which before rolling).
You achieve what you wanted. Burn two tags from a theme.
Otherscape.moves.blazeOfGlory.noReturn.n: Go out in a Blaze (No Return)
Otherscape.moves.blazeOfGlory.noReturn.f: The moment turns agaisnt you or you fail to achieve what you hoped. Replace a theme (chosen before rolling)
Otherscape.moves.blazeOfGlory.noReturn.p: You achieve what you wanted. Replace a theme (chosen before rolling)
Otherscape.moves.blazeOfGlory.noReturn.s: You achieve what you wanted. Burn all tags in a theme (choose which before rolling).
Otherscape.moves.blazeOfGlory.ultimate.f: The moment turns agaisnt you or you fail to achieve what you hoped. Take a tier-6 status, it cannot be mitigated.
Otherscape.moves.blazeOfGlory.ultimate.p: You achieve what you wanted. Take a tier-6 status, it cannot be mitigated.
Otherscape.moves.blazeOfGlory.ultimate.s: You achieve what you wanted. Replace a theme (chosen before rolling)
Otherscape.moves.downtime.name: Downtime
Otherscape.moves.downtime.always: Each player may represent this actiivty by spending 3 power (without making a roll) or by marking an upgrade box on one of their themes. Alternately the player may forgo downtime benefits and resolve their activity as a player action.
Otherscape.moves.downtime.0: Heal and Recover (Restore): Recovering burned power tags during downtime costs 1 power per tag instead of 2.
Otherscape.moves.downtime.1: Prepare for Action (bestow, create, enhance, loadout) : Loadout tags obtained now are added to the PC's loadout theme, butmust be loaded up as normal. Altnerativel, the PC may save some or all of thier power to to the total power they spend on their next loadup.
Otherscape.moves.downtime.2: Quality Time (Bestow, Disrupt): Spend time with a chosen character or characters. Creates relationship story tag to represent the relationship.
Otherscape.moves.downtime.4: Spend Time on a theme: Mark an upgrade box.
Otherscape.moves.creditRoll.name: Credit Roll
Otherscape.moves.creditRoll.always: At the end of each session, as the imaginary credits are rolling, take some time to discuss what has transpired in this episode of your series.
Otherscape.moves.creditRoll.0: What did the crew achieve? What new trouble did they get into?
Otherscape.moves.creditRoll.1: What were the highlight moments of the episode?
Otherscape.moves.creditRoll.2: Individually, what was the most important thing that happened to each PC?
Otherscape.moves.creditRoll.3: Did any PCs mark Decay, replace a theme, or have a Moment of Evolution?
Otherscape.moves.creditRoll.4: Did anyone Go Out In A Blaze? What was the outcome and the Consequences?
Otherscape.moves.creditRoll.5: If you’re playing a series, each PC has one relationship tag with another PC. First, any such burned tags are restored. Then, go around the table; ask each player whether any of their PC’s relationships with the other PCs changed. If so, they can revise their relationship tags with other PCs to reflect that.
Otherscape.moves.creditRoll.6: Recover one crew theme power tag for each member in the crew
Otherscape.moves.creditRoll.7: You may also ask the MC to add any story tags that represent resources you gained access to this session to your loadout theme.
Otherscape.essence.Nexus.name: Nexus
Otherscape.essence.Spiritualist.name: Spiritualist
Otherscape.essence.Cyborg.name: Cyborg
Otherscape.essence.Transhuman.name: Transhuman
Otherscape.essence.Real.name: Real
Otherscape.essence.Avatar.name: Avatar
Otherscape.essence.Conduit.name: Conduit
Otherscape.essence.Singularity.name: Singularity
CityOfMist.message.noExtraSelected: No Extra Theme Selected (either give players ownership over a Danger/Extra type actor with a theme or drag and drop a themebook or themekit)
CityOfMist.message.noCrewSelected: No Crew Theme Selected (create a crew Actor and give players ownership to view it here)
CityOfMist.message.noThemeSelected: No Theme (either click the add Theme button or drag and drop a themebook or themekit)

CityOfMist.themebook.adaption.reference: See City of Mist Player's Guide page 83-85
CityOfMist.themebook.adaption.imp.0.name: Game Changer
CityOfMist.themebook.adaption.imp.1.name: Tap Into The Source
CityOfMist.themebook.adaption.imp.2.name: I Have Just The Thing
CityOfMist.themebook.adaption.imp.3.name: Creative Stroke
CityOfMist.themebook.adaption.imp.4.name: Specialization
CityOfMist.themebook.advancedart.name: Advanced Art
CityOfMist.themebook.bastion.name: Bastion
CityOfMist.themebook.bastion.reference: See City of Mist Player's Guide page 87-89
CityOfMist.themebook.bastion.imp.0.name: Unbreakable
CityOfMist.themebook.bastion.imp.1.name: Got your Back
CityOfMist.themebook.bastion.imp.2.name: Sacrifice
CityOfMist.themebook.bastion.imp.3.name: Sorry, was that your gun?

CityOfMist.themebook.definingevent.refer: See City of Mist Player's Guide page 110-113
CityOfMist.themebook.definingrelationshi: See City of Mist Player's Guide page 114-117
CityOfMist.themebook.destiny.name: Destiny
CityOfMist.themebook.destiny.imp.0.name: Destiny Manifest
CityOfMist.themebook.destiny.imp.1.name: S%#t’s Getting Real
CityOfMist.themebook.destiny.imp.2.name: What You’re Meant to Be
CityOfMist.themebook.destiny.imp.3.name: Delay Fate
CityOfMist.themebook.destiny.imp.4.name: Weave the Starry Web of Fortune
CityOfMist.themebook.divination.name: Divination
CityOfMist.themebook.divination.referenc: See City of Mist Player's Guide page 90-93
CityOfMist.themebook.enclave.name: Enclave
CityOfMist.themebook.enclave.imp.0.name: Legendary Headquarters
CityOfMist.themebook.enclave.imp.1.name: Bastion of Mythos
CityOfMist.themebook.enclave.imp.2.name: Private Lab
CityOfMist.themebook.enclave.imp.3.name: Take Me Home
CityOfMist.themebook.enclave.imp.4.name: Maw of Conjurations

MistEngine.dialog.statusMerge.label: Merge {newStatus} with Status {existingStatus}
CityOfMist.dialog.roll.title: Make Roll
CityOfMist.dialog.postClue.title: Post Clue
CityOfMist.dialog.downtime.title: Possible Downtime Moves
CityOfMist.dialog.downtime.unburn: Prepare for your next activity. Tell everyone at the table how you prepare. Unburn all burned tags
CityOfMist.dialog.downtime.juice: Prepare for your next activity. Tell everyone at the table how you prepare. Gain 3 Juice with a method based on your description. You can choose from the effect improvements under Change the Game.
CityOfMist.dialog.downtimeconfirm.title: Downtime Confirmation
CityOfMist.dialog.downtimeconfirm.body: Would you like to begin Downtime for all players?
CityOfMist.dialog.pcdowntime.title: Downtime For
CityOfMist.dialog.addTag.confirmExtraImp: Grant a free improvement for taking 2+ weakness tags on same theme?
CityOfMist.dialog.deleteTag.confirmExtra: Remove the free improvement for taking 2+ weakness tags on a theme?
CityOfMist.dialog.actorSheet.deleteTheme: Delete Theme without adding Build-up points? This action can't be undone.
CityOfMist.dialog.actorSheet.addFade.bod: This action will cause the theme to be destroyed (you will get build-up points). Are you sure?
CityOfMist.dialog.tag.usageExamples: Examples of where Tag would apply
CityOfMist.dialog.tag.counterExamples: Examples of where Tag wouldn't apply
CityOfMist.dialog.tag.restrictions: General Restrictions to the tag's usage
CityOfMist.dialog.SHB.warning0: Are you sure you want to Stop.Holding.Back?
CityOfMist.dialog.endOfSession.name: End Of Session
CityOfMist.dialog.tagReview.title: Review Tags
CityOfMist.dialog.tagReview.purpose: MC can review tags and accept/reject them
CityOfMist.settings.gritMode.name: Grit Mode
CityOfMist.settings.gritMode.hint: Enables Grit Mode (as described in the rules)
CityOfMist.settings.weaknessCap.name: Cap Weakness Rolls
CityOfMist.settings.weaknessCap.hint: Place a cap on total Power on moves involving weakness tags.
CityOfMist.settings.maxWeaknessTags.name: Maximum Weakness Tags
CityOfMist.settings.maxWeaknessTags.hint: Maximum allowed weakness tags on a single move
CityOfMist.settings.maxRollCap.name: Max Roll Bonus Cap
CityOfMist.settings.maxRollCap.hint: Place a cap on the maximum bonus on a roll (does not reduce power for purpose of a move's efffect)
CityOfMist.settings.monologueAttention.h: Awards Attention to player's least developed theme for opening monologue
CityOfMist.settings.loggedActions.name: Character Edit Logging
CityOfMist.settings.loggedActions.hint: Whisper to GM when character changes are made
CityOfMist.settings.autoWeakness.name: Auto-apply Weakness Attention
CityOfMist.settings.autoWeakness.hint: Automatically add an attention when a weakness tag is used
CityOfMist.settings.autoAwardWeaknessImp: When adding 2 or more weakness tags to a theme you will automatically gain a bonus improvement ot that theme. If this is switched off a prompt will instead come up.
CityOfMist.settings.execEntranceMoves.hi: Set Automation options for 'enter scene' type moves on dangers. Triggers when token is revealed or created. Removed when token is hidden or deleted.
CityOfMist.settings.tokenToolTip.name: Token Tooltips
CityOfMist.settings.tokenToolTip.hint: When hovering over a token, display its story tags and statuses.
CityOfMist.settings.trackerSort.name: Status/Tag Tracker sorting method
CityOfMist.settings.trackerSort.hint: How the Tracker sorts the PCs and dangers
CityOfMist.settings.trackerSort.2: Elevate PCs and Dangers with tags/statuses
CityOfMist.settings.enhancedActorDirecto: Shows only the alias name to non-owners of an actor in the directory, hiding the true name from the players (requires browser refresh)
CityOfMist.settings.soundEffects.name: Sound Effects
CityOfMist.settings.soundEffects.hint: Produce sound effects for tag selection, burning, etc.
CityOfMist.settings.clueBoxes.name: Enhanced Clue System
CityOfMist.settings.clueBoxes.hint: Clues are spawned as separate interactive chat objects (clue boxes) that the player and GM can fill out.
CityOfMist.settings.tagReview.name: MC Tag Review
CityOfMist.settings.tagReview.hint: Before roll is made MC gets to review what tags and statuses are included.
CityOfMist.settings.flashyLevelUp.name: Flashing Level Up Indicator
CityOfMist.settings.flashyLevelUp.hint: Adds a flashing level up indicator to themes that can be advanced.
CityOfMist.settings.gmmoveheaders.name: Danger Move starting text
CityOfMist.settings.gmmoveheaders.hint: Automatically Apply an identifier to the start of each danger's move based on its type (soft, hard, etc)
CityOfMist.settings.sceneTagWindow.name: Scene Tags
CityOfMist.settings.sceneTagWindow.hint: Displays scene tags and statuses on the main screen (may cause screen clutter)
CityOfMist.settings.sceneTagWindow.choic: Include combatants with at least one tag or status
Include all combatants on combat tracker
CityOfMist.settings.sceneTagWindowPositi: Position on screen that the Scene Tag Window will appear
CityOfMist.settings.devMode.name: Developer Mode
CityOfMist.settings.devMode.hint: Exposes various internal variables of the system (advanced use only).
CityOfMist.settings.statusAdditionSystem: Choose which system to use when adding statuses
CityOfMist.settings.altPower.name: Alternate Power House Rule
CityOfMist.settings.altPower.hint: Roll power just impacts the die roll. For move effect, base effect is set to 2 and can be modified via a penalty.
CityOfMist.settings.system.name: Game System
CityOfMist.settings.system.hint: Choose version of CoM system (this will overwrite settings and set the system defaults for the chosen system)
CityOfMist.settings.movesInclude.name: Core Moves Included
CityOfMist.settings.movesInclude.hint: Choose which core moves to include, useful for developers who want to customize the moves for their games
CityOfMist.settings.baseSystem.name: Base System
CityOfMist.settings.baseSystem.hint: The base system upon which most of the rules are drawn.
CityOfMist.settings.tagCreationCost.name: Tag Creation Cost
CityOfMist.settings.tagCreationCost.hint: Amount of Power Required to Create a new Tag (Mist Engine Only)
CityOfMist.settings.statusCreationCost.h: Amount of Power Required to Create a new Status (Mist Engine Only)
CityOfMist.settings.loadout.name: Enable Loadout Theme
CityOfMist.settings.loadout.hint: Show the Loadout theme on the character Sheet
CityOfMist.settings.statusDisplay.name: Status Display
CityOfMist.settings.statusDisplay.hint: Show how statuses are shown in the status Lists
CityOfMist.settings.tagBurn.name: Tag Burning Mechanic
CityOfMist.settings.tagBurn.hint: Handles the effects of burning tags are burned in the system
CityOfMist.settings.themeStyle.name: Theme Card Style
Determine how the rules handle scale / Collective
CityOfMist.settings.debugMode.name: Debug Mode
CityOfMist.settings.debugMode.hint: Turns on internal Javascript debug code
CityOfMist.settings.handleTempItems.name: Temp Status/Tags
CityOfMist.settings.handleTempItems.hint: What to do when a temporary/crispy tag or status is used in a roll
CityOfMist.settings.handleTempItems.choi: Burn Temporary and crispy tags and delete statuses
CityOfMist.settings.autofail.name: Auto success/fail
CityOfMist.settings.autofail.hint: natural 2 and 12 are automatic failure and success (respectively)
Otherscape.settings.autoEssence.name: Auto Determine Essence
Otherscape.settings.autoEssence.hint: Automatically determine Essence when possible (doesn't work for Avatar vs Conduit)
CityOfMist.keybinds.narration.name: Narration Box
CityOfMist.keybinds.narration.hint: Used for Narrating scenes (has special tag and status synatx similar to GM moves)
CityOfMist.keybinds.sessionEnd.name: Session End
CityOfMist.keybinds.sessionEnd.hint: Initiates the End of Session Move for all players, refreshing Flashbacks and other session-based resources.
CityOfMist.keybinds.startDowntime.name: Start Downtime
CityOfMist.keybinds.startDowntime.hint: Triggers downtime choices for all players and allows the MC to select from downtime moves of visible and invisible tokens actors on current scene
CityOfMist.keybinds.storyTagHider.name: Hide/Show Story Tag Window
CityOfMist.keybinds.storyTagHider.hint: Press the shortcut key to hide or show the Story Tag Window
CityOfMist.tooltip.toggleTokenInStoryTag: Add/remove token from Scene Tag window.
CityOfMist.tooltip.gmmove: Use [] around a word to make a status or tag. [a:name] will make a status auto-applied when the move is triggered. [i:name] will ignore collective bonus. [a,i:name] will do both. [s:name] will add the used status or tag to the scene tags/statuses. Using {} around a block of text will make it visible only to the GM. That text will not post to chat.&#013 Other Commands: &#013 &#013 t: make status temporary, &#013 p: permanent make tag permanent
CityOfMist.tooltip.error.missingParent: ERROR: This tag needs to be a sub-tag of another tag.
CityOfMist.error.dontOwnTag: You don't own this tag and can't edit it
General.error.LOTagNotLoaded: Loadout tags must be loaded before they can be used
General.error.LinkedTagError: Can't select as you already have selected a tag/status which created this one.
General.error.LinkedTagError2: Can't select this item as one of your already selected tags and statuses was created by it.
CityOfMist.notification.reloadRequired: Browser Window will reload shortly for all players due to setting change
